}}{{TIDTOC|embedded}} ==Overview== '''SB-FX6M Rev1.31''' is silkscreened on the base board and '''CM-FX6 rev 1.0''' is silkscreened on the SOM.
{{see also|List of Single-board computers}}
===Specifications=== *CPU: [[NXP]] i.MX6Q @1.2GHz (Quad-core ARM Cortex-A9) :Vivante GC2000, GC355, GC320 *2GB RAM, 32GB ''SanDisk'' mSATA SSD (internal) *802.11bgn Wi-Fi, 2x 1Gb Ethernet *4x USB 2.0 ports, HDMI, DVI-D, SDHC Card reader *SPDIF, 3.5mm Line Out
==Links of Interest== *[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Utilite ''Utilite'' on '''Wikipedia'''] *[https://www.compulab.com/wp-content/uploads/2014/07/CM-FX6-reference-guide.pdf ''CM-FX6 CoM Reference Guide'' at '''Compulab''']
===News=== *[https://www.cnx-software.com/2013/07/15/99-and-up-compulab-utilite-arm-based-computer-runs-ubuntu-or-android/ ''$99 (and up) Compulab Utilite ARM based Computer'' on '''CNX-Software'''] *[https://liliputing.com/2013/10/utilite-arm-based-linux-pc-now-available-99.html ''Utilite ARM-based Linux PC now available for $99'' on '''liliputing'''] *[https://www.phoronix.com/scan.php?page=article&item=compulab_utilite ''CompuLab Utilite: A Tiny, Low-Power, Low-Cost, ARM Linux Desktop'' on '''Phoronix''']
